hedline.hl1: Metro Business; Dance Group Gets Grant

abstract.p: Dance Theater of Harlem will receive $2.3 million matching grant to help it pay off debts, strengthen management structure and perform more frequently in Harlem; money is awarded by Upper Manhattan Empowerment Zone, federal, state and city program devised to stimulate economic development (S)

block.p: The Dance Theater of Harlem will receive a $2.3 million matching grant to help it pay off its debts, strengthen its management structure and perform more frequently in Harlem, officials announced yesterday.

The money was awarded to the struggling 31-year-old ballet company on Aug. 21 by the Upper Manhattan Empowerment Zone, a federal, state and city program devised to stimulate economic development. Under the terms of the grant, the dance company will be required to raise $5.7 million on its own to receive the $2.3 million, said Terry C. Lane, the president of the Empowerment Zone.

The Dance Theater of Harlem will receive a $2.3 million matching grant to help it pay off its debts, strengthen its management structure and perform more frequently in Harlem, officials announced yesterday.

The money was awarded to the struggling 31-year-old ballet company on Aug. 21 by the Upper Manhattan Empowerment Zone, a federal, state and city program devised to stimulate economic development. Under the terms of the grant, the dance company will be required to raise $5.7 million on its own to receive the $2.3 million, said Terry C. Lane, the president of the Empowerment Zone.

The Dance Theater's season at City Center began on Wednesday and will end on Sept. 17. Mr. Mitchell said that the grant would enable the company to perform more frequently at the Aaron Davis Hall and other sites in Harlem.
